pr_title: Adding WLDF and JMS system override tests

timeline.message: Adding situational config overrides tests for JMS and WLDF resources

timeline.bodyText:
Does it mean two dynamic clusters with two managed server each ?
Specify which domain model is being used.
timeline.author: anpanigr

replies.bodyText: changed the wording, it is 1 domain, 1 cluster and 2 ms in it.
replies.author: sankarpn

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItSystemResOverrides.java b/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItSystemResOverrides.java
index abf386bd57..11d84b4d78 100644
--- a/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItSystemResOverrides.java
+++ b/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItSystemResOverrides.java

@@ -132,7 +132,7 @@ public class ItSystemResOverrides {
    * Assigns unique namespaces for operator and domains.
    * Pulls WebLogic image if running tests in Kind cluster.
    * Installs operator.
-   * Creates and starts WebLogic domain containing 2 instances in dynamic cluster.
+   * Creates and starts a WebLogic domain with a dynamic cluster containing 2 managed server instances.
    * Creates JMS and WLDF system resources.
    * Deploys sitconfig application to cluster and admin targets.
    *

timeline.bodyText: Can we make  REST call to Admin Server to get System Resource Runtime MBean to verify the Override, instead of using a web application to check the override ?
timeline.author: anpanigr

replies.bodyText: It will be too much in the test code. For JMS its ok, but in WLDF there are lot of overrides that needs to be verified so it is better to stick with the application.
replies.author: sankarpn
